website_summaries.verdict: This kit includes a decent rocket as well as almost everything else you will need to make it fly.
pros: Includes a launch pad and launch controller with the parts you need for the rocket
cons: Though this kit includes a lot, you will still need to purchase several additional items to make it fly

customer_reviews.title: Right box wrong rocket!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Alpha III for my son for Christmas. He was very excited to start building it. We opened up the Alpha III box and inside was a whirlybird box and rocket. We would have just kept it but the whirlybird only takes C6-5 engines and we have A8-5. Disappointed kid. Update: Returned and reordered the Alpha III rocket. New one came today with yet another rocket inside the Alpha III box. What the hell is going on here?
customer_reviews.author: photo412

customer_reviews.title: Scam - different rocket inside with a slightly smaller box!  This is illegal.
customer_reviews.text: Read title, see picture - an Estes Flicker came inside, as if we wouldn't notice...or more accurately, as if we would just accept it and truck on. Nope, going back. Amazon...you need to check this vendor!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Duped a 9 year old on Easter, scumbag move
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my son for Easter. Someone took a different rocket and stuck it in the box for the advertised rocket. I bought engines for the advertised rocket that won’t fit the one I got. Completely unacceptable and an obvious intentional act as someone put the one box in the other box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I forgot how much fun model rocketry is
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year-old and I had fun putting the rocket together Christmas morning (she dropped the Shopkins for the rocket), and after picking up some motors at the local hobby shop, we went to a local field and let 'er rip. Four launches and four successful recoveries later, and we're looking forward to building bigger and more intricate rockets. Can't wait for spring (or another good freeze).
customer_reviews.author: James Altemus

customer_reviews.title: Seriously? A re-pack?
customer_reviews.text: When I pay for something directly from a company such as Estes, I expect a new and never opened item. The rocket launch kit I received appears to have been opened previously and re-packed. Not impressed and will likely be sending it back. This was intended as a birthday gift for a 10-year old boy...I will check the local hobby stores instead for a truly new item. C'mon Estes, you are (or maybe were) better than that.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: What goes up must come down but hell if we know where!?!
customer_reviews.text: This was a first rocket build and launch together. We had a lot of fun building it and then to see that work come to fruition with a successful launch makes the joy all the more greater. We are hoping to launch it a few more times but we lost sight of it and have no idea where it touched down at. I'm hoping that someone will see my Facebook post and return it but if not I am not worried. We are definitely planning on doing this more often!
customer_reviews.author: s.haulk77

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for my five-year-old grandson
customer_reviews.text: I know I am a kind of a nerd. I made many Estes rockets myself when I was a kid ages ago. I thought my grandson would enjoy this for his birthday and boy was I right. He enjoyed building it and then we immediately went and flew it several times. Easy to use and a lot of fun. Much better then and electronic game were you just sit in front of the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: good starter kit; rocket engines required separately.
customer_reviews.text: A great starter kit and good value for the price. The kit contains a no-frills but easy-to-assemble rocket, launch pad, and igniter. Lacks engines (A8-3 or similar needed) and a little craft glue (White school glue works just fine). Good place to start because you don't have to worry about cutting or sealing balsa wood fins, gluing them straight, etc. You can assemble in a few hours (most time is to let the glue dry) and fly as soon as everything dries.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Lost the rocket, doesn't come with everything to use right away.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and son put this together it shot up high nicely but unfortunately they only got to use it once because the wind caught it and took the rocket through the neighborhood. We drove around but couldn't find it and this kit doesn't come with replacements nor the things to shoot them into the sky actually. We had to go to hobby lobby to buy the projectiles for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: Launch controllers did not function
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these for my sons for an event. Did all assembly ahead of time. Went event, set up launch pad, and ....nothing. Red "ready" light would not light up on either launch controller, and rockets would not fire. Borrowed someone else's launch controller (did not change anything else), and it worked, so I know it was not user error. Unfortunately, the launch controllers are of poor quality - hope yours work better than the ones I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: m.rive

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure You Open Upon Receiving
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how the Alpha III performs. I order it, but, once I opened the box for my daughter, there was another box inside containing the wrong rocket kit. No time to return it and wait on the right product to arrive sue to my work schedule, so hopefully my kid will be ok with the wrong item
customer_reviews.author: Dustin B

customer_reviews.title: Fraud
customer_reviews.text: Finally opened it and theres a completely different rocket box inside of the Alpha III box. Smh
customer_reviews.author: Saundra

customer_reviews.title: Rocket Science
customer_reviews.text: We bought this rocket for my son for his birthday party as a favor for the boys. He turned 11 and we got them a week before the party so they could put them together at home and then at the party launch them as a group one by one. Most of the kids were not able to put them together correctly, so I would suggest that they make it easier. 3 out of 4 launched and 2 worked as instructed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t have correct parts inside very disappointed in purchase Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: ThompsonCrew

customer_reviews.title: Where is the rocket?
customer_reviews.text: This says includes rocket in the description and on the box... there is no rocket included.
customer_reviews.author: kcrown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Starter
customer_reviews.text: Great starter kit. The Alpha III set has most of the basics for getting a simple model rocket into the air. The pre-molded plastic fin assembly was a huge relief as it reduced the effort of assembly, and increased confidence that the Alpha would fly straight and true. The launch set is easy to assembly and disassemble making for ease of movement to and from a potential launch site. Many motor selections available for the Alpha III chassis allows for low altitude launches in less ideal wind conditions, or more punchy motors for more extreme altitudes to keep the younger rocketeers excited and interested.
customer_reviews.author: Gerrad Friedline

customer_reviews.title: Now what it seems.
customer_reviews.text: Just opened this and it was a box inside a box and repacked contents. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Road Legal 4WD

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and lots of fun. Flies great and makes for an inexpensive hobby. Grand daughter thought it was fun and cool as well. Get some motors and wadding too...you will need them. Get some of the small motors. Oh...and cut a 3" hole in the parachute or it will take and drift forever with the big motors...this one goes up and out of site till the chute deploys.
customer_reviews.author: Deepjet

customer_reviews.title: Could be too short for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Instructions are poor but it's not rocket science. I would recommend this model with one caveat: The short height may be a problem. It is difficult to get enough wadding and a well-packed parachute in. An extra inch or two would make packing the parachute much easier, IMHO. It worked, but I think a slightly taller model would be good for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Nibake

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Kit
customer_reviews.text: This kit has ALMOST everything you need to launch rockets. You need glue to finish building the rocket. You'll also need rocket engines and wadding. The launchpad ROD is a bit thin and comes in 3 pieces that you fit together. Pretty easy to bend (which isn't good), but I see now other way to easily ship in such a small box.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Durable.
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun project that was a bit of a challenge to build, mostly with my 7 year old grandson. But it flew well with no problems at all. The launcher worked well, too. The rocket body itself, though, isn't intended for more that a few lift-offs as it deteriorated quickly. I give it 3.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oterson

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun, easy to build
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together and worked great. My daughters (8 and 9) helped build it and love firing it off. We had everything put together in about 45 minutes, but probably would have taken less time with less kid help. I have ordered more engines and another rocket just in case we loose this one. This is highly recommended for a starter rocket.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Kumfer

customer_reviews.title: Good starter kit
customer_reviews.text: The rocket is more or less the starter model... just push everything together, glue on the guide tube and the parachute and stick on some stickers and you are ready to fly. My 8 year old loved it and everything worked perfectly. Don't forget to order engines and parachute wadding. Also don't be surprised if your kid gets addicted and wants you to build a 4' tall multistage rocket next!
customer_reviews.author: BLS FL

customer_reviews.title: Family Fun Outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: Nephew thoroughly enjoys shooting rockets with this kit. The only downfall of this kit is the cheaply made launch controller. Launch rating with this controller was about 40% and that was after it blew out the igniters without launching the rocket.. We went out and bought the Estes E Launch Controller and haven't had a misfire yet on 6 launches and no burn outs. The Alpha III rocket was easy to assemble and climbs to incredible heights. Loads of fun for the entire family!
customer_reviews.author: Cal5

customer_reviews.title: was able to teach the basics of aerodynamics and it was easy to build (whole thing in about 1 hour)
customer_reviews.text: Science Class for a Christian Youth Group required a rocket for them to see fly and understand. This model came complete and worked well, with lots of excitement, and participation. The system as a whole, was able to teach the basics of aerodynamics and it was easy to build (whole thing in about 1 hour). If you follow instructions well, this kit is for you. Engines must be ordered separately.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs We Care

customer_reviews.title: Nice first rocket kit. Bad directions
customer_reviews.text: Good value for dollar but directions are so minimal and confusing. Best to watch a youtube video to assemble. You also need to buy engines, igniter starters and wadding separately
customer_reviews.author: J. Kempiak

customer_reviews.title: one step up from ready to launch
customer_reviews.text: This kit is one step away from ready to launch giving you an opportunity to try an inexpensive rocket build that gives you a flyable rocket in a few easy steps. You or the kids can whet your whistle with this one and get a feel for bigger more complex rocket builds in the future. Enjoyable family fun quick build on a Friday night followed by a Sunday afternoon launch or whenever the glue dries.
customer_reviews.author: john colarusso

customer_reviews.title: Great option when working on Boy Scout merit badge
customer_reviews.text: We've been building rockets at school events and with the scouts for years. Picked up this kit to build to work on a merit badge. Wish they had included the motors and recovery wadding in the box, but otherwise it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Bibbs

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Not what I bought... this Flicker box, as seen in the photos, was INSIDE the box for the Alpha III, the indicated item. On top of that, it didn't even have all the parts. This was a bday gift for my son, thus the delay between purchase and review
customer_reviews.author: Devin M. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Rocket and launchpad nice, launch control button is a non-starter
customer_reviews.text: The launch pad and rocket work fine. Easy to assemble, just be careful with the launch guide bar, bends easily. I rated this at two stars because the launch button did not work, and I couldn’t repair it. It was ok, because I used it as a moment to teach my daughter about designing and wiring a new launch control from scratch. Just an honest review on the launch button if you are looking for a quality launcher out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: oldschool

customer_reviews.text: Reliving a fond childhood memory? I did and I have no regrets. My son had fun too. The rocket is easy to build and launch. Read the wind, aim, count down and woosh.
customer_reviews.author: William M

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Other than the wadding, engines, and 4 AA batteries, this kit comes with everything that you need to put a rocket in the air. You'll also need some things that you probably already have around the house. ie. Elmer's glue, scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Instructions  on site does not reveal parts needed
customer_reviews.text: the site did not say the product needed other articles to operate, was on box after receiving. was for Christmas for 13 year who was very disappointed...never again
customer_reviews.author: sammy

customer_reviews.title: Great for first time rocket builders
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need for the beginner. Go ahead and buy some of the larger engines for future flights but be sure to go to a wide open area to launch because the larger engines will make it travel probably 3 times the distance.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Neal

customer_reviews.title: Easy launch platform
customer_reviews.text: I would pay double for nicer materials and camera mounts, but I suppose that need to be a custom build.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great value, easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: This kit comes with everything. All you need is scissors and glue. We are still using the launch pad and ignition system with many other rockets, Never had an issue. The rockets eventually have to be replaced, but there or endless options. Our launch pad has seen atleast 25+ launches without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchase engines separate
customer_reviews.text: So we haven’t used this yet, as it is a Christmas gift for my son. But it didn’t come with the engine, guessing I didn’t read the full description, and seems to be a lot smaller than what I remember the size of these rockets being. But none the less, purchase engines separate. Still should bring back memories while doing this project with my son
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Great price but quality is lacking
customer_reviews.text: Great price but quality is lacking. Not an issue as i didnt expext it to last that long. Remote control launcher is intermittent at times as you have to wiggle the key and hold the launch button for several seconds in the hopes the igniter ignites.
customer_reviews.author: TaraC

customer_reviews.title: Shot it off in my backyard which is huge with no trees and first time it was perfect, second time though it ended up a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely do not have any trees not even somewhat close to you. Shot it off in my backyard which is huge with no trees and first time it was perfect, second time though it ended up a few houses over in the neighbors tree which we couldn't recover due to the tree being massive
customer_reviews.author: LenaBean

customer_reviews.title: Great rocket kit
customer_reviews.text: Good value for rocket, launch pad and launcher. But . . . The kit should include rocket engine and everything needed to launch.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry & Jane Malakosky

customer_reviews.title: Launch controller doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Built the rocket just fine. Went to go launch it with my daughter and the launch controller didn’t work. Disappointing. I had rockets when I was a kid and was looking forward to launching this with my daughter who is really into space right now
customer_reviews.author: Justin Zimerman

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Great fun. Easier to assemble than the ones you have to glue the fins on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work as expected
customer_reviews.text: Was one of my sons birthday presents, and he was so excited. Went together easily. Battery/igniter didn’t work. Batteries actually started melting wrapper off battery. Would not ignite engine. Have to order another battery/igniter
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Starter is junk!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Starter did not work! Another print shipping label and run around f@÷I that don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Kavanagh

customer_reviews.title: Super fun small rocket
customer_reviews.text: I've launched this twice with my son and it worked great, he was excited to see it floating down with its parachute. Easy to put together and launch.
customer_reviews.author: jmnvhc

customer_reviews.title: Neh
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with allot of items that are hard to find, not worth the money in less you already know where to get parts.
customer_reviews.author: Vance

customer_reviews.title: Partially Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: The rocket and launch pad are good but the electric launch controller is defective! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: A in WC

customer_reviews.title: Cool little rocket
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble with my young son. Shot it off, never saw it again. I probably packed the chute to right causing it not to deploy.
customer_reviews.author: Shey

customer_reviews.title: Rockets away
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my nephew & his two sons !!! & me too
customer_reviews.author: John J.    CTCA  CT.

customer_reviews.title: As close to an all in one rocket launch as I have found
customer_reviews.text: Excellent small launch pad. The ignition system is a little cheap, but it works. Just need engines and recovery wadding
customer_reviews.author: DEG0

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro  Rocket Kit
customer_reviews.text: This rocket is a classic. I had this same kit when I was a kid, so I bought one for my youngest daughter. She loves it. for younger kids (say 6-9), it's a simple kit that they will love.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! I unboxed the rocket and all the parts. No top for the rocket! My kids were so excited and then pure disappointment when I told them wo could not put it together. How does this even happen?
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: It went FUUUSH then POP
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old and 4 year old loved this, both making it and firing it off was a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas, and with the weather now nice we opened it up to build. There is no nose cone in the package. It's been six months since I ordered so I am probably out of luck, and disappointed to say the least...
customer_reviews.author: PMC

customer_reviews.title: Great fun with the family.
customer_reviews.text: Great launch pad and remote. The rocket was real simple the nose and tail are both plastic. Just a few things to glue and your done. My kids love launching the rockets and chasing them down.
customer_reviews.author: reddraco

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Rocket
customer_reviews.text: Awesome rocket! I didn't read careful so I didn't realize it needed separate engines to work, we had to buy those from a local hobby store.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Pole connections broke, engines did not ignite - it uses AA batteries, not enough power
customer_reviews.text: Pole connections broke as soon as my kid grabbed it. Engines did not ignite - it uses AA batteries, not enough power
customer_reviews.author: Al Su

customer_reviews.title: Alpha III is a best first rocket for anyone
customer_reviews.text: Alpha III is a best first rocket for anyone. Have had a few. Bought the kit to replace an old launcher.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P Davis

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, cheap fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, cheap fun for the kids! You can spend quality time together building this rocket! Almost real if you have an imagination!
customer_reviews.author: SARGE

customer_reviews.title: Rocket Man is born!
customer_reviews.text: Grandson & I put this together in an hour or so even though the instructions are not all that great. Can't see it lasting for a year as after a half dozen launches the cardboard is starting to get soft and pliable and the nose cone getting looser. It does get up and go and the company was very quick in replacing the defective launcher that came with the original package.It does go high enough that you need a large field to shoot in. Any wind at all will make it drift quite a ways.
customer_reviews.author: Dapusher

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: It was a fun activity to do with my son.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: 11 yr old boy LOVES it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for an 11 yr old boy. He has had a ball with this. Don't forget the wadding, starters and glue!!!
customer_reviews.author: daminfla

customer_reviews.title: Additional purchases necessary to launch rockets
customer_reviews.text: There are additional items needed to get this kit to work. It would be helpful for beginners to know this.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you buy the motor to go with it
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t realize it didn’t come with a motor that should’ve been the first thing in the details
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it. The adjustable rod angle allowed us to ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it. The adjustable rod angle allowed us to launch into the wind. 8 out of 10 launches last Saturday landed within 30 feet of the launch pad.
customer_reviews.author: Old new Battery

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great intro model... however after 4 launches the cardboard/body of the rocket began to mushroom.
customer_reviews.author: Rural Station

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The launcher didn’t work, after putting batteries in - no launch no light on.....
customer_reviews.author: Soo Bosley

customer_reviews.title: Came with the red stand and red controller
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with the same same stand as shown but works fine all the same.
customer_reviews.author: xeno

customer_reviews.title: Cool rocket, and if your kid rips box opens ...
customer_reviews.text: Cool rocket, and if your kid rips box opens and accidently losses the rubber band thing you need, Amazon sells the replacement for a nice low cost!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Camacho

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I couldnt ask for anything more! The product offered me free next day shipping and it was worth it, the launches went off perfectly and tje rockets were flying. Everything held up great and felt like it was made with great quality materials!
customer_reviews.author: Marco Cortina

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent starter kit my son loves it. First rocket launched when he was 5. Great kit no problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: this was purchased for the model rocketry honor of our Pathfinder club in which the kids must launch and retrieve a single stage rocket. This served our purposes perfectly and fit our budget as well.
customer_reviews.author: jdmiles

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my son - works great - you just have to order the wadding and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son - works great - you just have to order the wadding and the engines
customer_reviews.author: Christian Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for our homeschool science experiments. Won't last forever but did okay for what we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: L. Graybill

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good set. Had a blast with my kids. Everything worked right the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: My boys loved this rocket
customer_reviews.text: My boys loved this rocket. Very easy to put together and get off the launch pad. Directions are clear and it seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. Easy to put together. It goes super high! Great beginner rocket.
customer_reviews.author: Michella Fonte

customer_reviews.title: bad quality
customer_reviews.text: this is cheap quality the rod was bent did not fit in holes
customer_reviews.author: R. Koltur

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good Price on Starter Set. Rocket does great but wish the base was better quality
customer_reviews.author: John Brabrand

customer_reviews.title: Engine not included
customer_reviews.text: I thought the whole point of having an all in one package was to have everything included including the engines thanks for ruining my kids Christmas
customer_reviews.author: NATE BOLLING-GOUTY JR

customer_reviews.title: great gift
customer_reviews.text: will be a great gift for my grandson's birthday. it's really for his dad...hehe.
customer_reviews.author: kathy highley

customer_reviews.title: Great Introduction Rocketry Kit
customer_reviews.text: This kit will provide you with everything you will need, except engines, to get into the sport of model rocketry. The set up is very easy. A saturday afternoon is all you should need to complete it. I send this kit to friends with kids very often to get them interested in the hobby. Everyone seems to love it.
customer_reviews.author: Oldmanriver

customer_reviews.title: Just a Cool set
customer_reviews.text: This rocket is pretty easy to build and is a great starter set for anyone trying to get into the model rocket hobby. This is how I got a few of my family members into model rockets.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Canchola

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you check what else you need to purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you check what else you need to purchase to make the rocket launch. Had to buy 4 other small things separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picture is wrong
customer_reviews.text: Its all there but the picture is so wrong. you get a cheap launch pad which I have never seen before from estes
customer_reviews.author: Iloveseattle

customer_reviews.title: Eight year old enjoyed building and launching
customer_reviews.text: Shipped as advertised. Eight year old enjoyed building and launching.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I had so much fun building this with my 7 year old. Make sure you buy engines.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Gigante

customer_reviews.title: Good fun
customer_reviews.text: Great fun, easy assembly (used crazy glue gel). 3 successful launch/returns.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Salomon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little rocket
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rocket for my son. Boy did it deliver! The only problem was that we live in a very rural area and the wind was probably a little too strong that day. We only got to launch it once, the wind carried it a pretty fair distance into a wheat field to never be seen again.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy Man

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself and your kids a favor and get an Estes kit today!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up doing model rockets. I have recently gotten back into it with my 2 year-old son and 4 year old daughter. What a great way to spend a few hours on the weekend. The kids love watching the rockets launch and then chasing them down. Estes is still the easiest way to get started. This kit is an easy an introduction and starter to model rocketry. Do yourself and your kids a favor and get it today!
customer_reviews.author: Earl Meyerson

customer_reviews.title: A great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: A great value for the money. I use it as part of a flight science class and get, literally, hundreds of launches out of the launcher itself; and upwards of 12 flights out of the rocket before it needs attention...
customer_reviews.author: Robert R. Reed Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice item. Have already used it
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping. Very nice item. Have already used it. Performs well!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Bartelson

customer_reviews.title: Launch system does NOT include electron beam launch controller & porta-pad II launch pad!
customer_reviews.text: Even though the picture shows the electron beam launch controller & porta-pad II launch pad, and the description lists it as the Launch system included, it is NOT. I comes with the inferior Astron II Launch Pad and Astron II Launch Controller. I called Amazon and returned this item and asked Amazon to update the picture and description to reflect the inferior parts included.
customer_reviews.author: J. Spangler

customer_reviews.title: No Engine, No Ignighters, No Wadding
customer_reviews.text: No wonder they were so cheap! These Alpha III kits do NOT include the engines, igniters, or wadding. When I received my Alpha III kit in 1984, it contained everything I needed to build and launch. Times have changed...
customer_reviews.author: Farmer Ted

customer_reviews.title: Estes, please stop cheapening your rockets
customer_reviews.text: Does not match item in the picture (or my youth). The launchpad and button are different. Still good but cheaper than the older versions.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: My boys and I enjoyed the rocket kit but the picture really should be ...
customer_reviews.text: My boys and I enjoyed the rocket kit but the picture really should be updated to show the actual parts be sold.

customer_reviews.title: Rocket Launch
customer_reviews.text: I am homeschooling my 7yr old in 2nd grade and this will be used for a science project. We haven't launched it yet but my son is excited to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Dressler

customer_reviews.title: Rocket was a bit difficult to build due to parts ...
customer_reviews.text: Rocket was a bit difficult to build due to parts not fitting (I think the cardboard expanded too much with glue) and lack of detailed instructions

customer_reviews.title: so I am pleased. I think my grandson will be happy with ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my grandson. It looks as described in the photo, so I am pleased. I think my grandson will be happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Patches

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: The rocket seems like it would be useful for what I bought it for, however the premade plastic fins for the bottom section are bent meaning if I try to launch this it will spin out of control. I am disappointed because I was excited for this was my first rocket.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

product_meta.title: Estes Alpha III Rocket Launch Set
product_meta.description:
Style:Single

The Estes Alpha III rocket launch set contains a launch controller, launch pad, and rocket kit packet with materials and instructions required to assemble the rocket. It is recommended for children 10 years and older with adult supervision up to age 12. The orange plastic nose cone, body tube, one-piece plastic tail fin unit, and self-stick decals allow assembly of the rocket without painting. Additional supplies required to launch the rocket include model rocket engine, starter, recovery wadding, and glue (sold separately). This rocket launch set provides the equipment required to launch (with required components) the Alpha III rocket repeatedly and is suitable for youth group activities such as with clubs and schools.

SpecificationsSkill levelEasy to Assemble (E2X), simple gluing, no paintingAge recommendation10 years and up, adult supervision under 12Recommended engines1/2A6-2, A8-3 (First Flight), A8-5, B4-4, B6-4, B6-6, C6-5, C6-7Projected maximum altitude1,100' (335m)Rocket weight1.2 oz. (34 g)Dimensions*12.3 x 0.98" (H x W)Required components (not included)Rocket Engine with Starter, such as Estes 001598 A8-3 Engine
Recovery Wadding, such as Estes 002274 Wadding
*H is height, the vertical distance from the lowest to highest point; W is width, the horizontal distance from left to right.

A model rocket kit includes reusable parts, and requires launching equipment and single-use launching supplies. These kits are recommended for children 10 years and older, with adult supervision advised to age 12. Rocket kit assembly encompasses a range of skill levels—from Easy-to-Assemble (E2X), requiring only simple gluing and less than an hour of time—to Level 5, requiring multi-step assembly with measuring, cutting, gluing, and painting tasks. Reusable rocket kit components include a cone, a body tube, and a recovery parachute. A rocket engine, a starter, and recovery wadding are used once. Rocket engines come in a variety of sizes, time delays, and burn durations. A "first-flight" engine recommendation is generally made for each rocket kit. A launch pad has a stable base and a vertical rod that provide vertical stability during initial liftoff. A launch controller has a keyed ignition switch to prevent accidental ignition, and a cable provides a safe distance from the rocket during launch. Bulk packs of model rocket kits are available for clubs and schools, and allow groups of children to experience building and launching a rocket.

Estes manufactures model rocket kits, launching equipment, and rocket engines. The company, founded in 1958, is headquartered in Penrose, CO.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
 * Alpha III assembly kit
 * Astron II launch controller
 * Astron II launch pad
 * Supply/instruction packet



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Join the hundreds of thousands of people who got their start in model rockets with this classic. The Estes Alpha III was the very first rocket in the E2X series. E2X (Easy to Assemble) is a rocket series designed with beginners in mind. With all colored rocket parts and easily applied self-stick decals, you’re ready for liftoff in minutes. The black body tube, bright orange nose cone and one piece fin unit build quickly into one flashy rocket. With nothing more needed than glue, you can be on the flying field in no time at all. Using standard Estes engines, the Alpha III soars to heights over 1,100' (335 m). Whether you’re a first time rocketeer or a long time flyer, this 12.3" (31.1 cm) Alpha III is a true classic that should be in everyones’ collection. What more could you ask for than a high performance, high flying, classic rocket. Assembly takes one hour or less. An Estes controller and launch system are included. Requires 4 - AA 1.5V batteries for the launch controller - sold separately. Recommended for ages 10 and up with adult supervision for those under 12.
feature_bullets: Launch controller, launch pad, and rocket assembly kit with materials and instructions Required to assemble the rocket
Orange plastic nose cone, body tube, one-piece plastic tail fin unit, and self-stick decals for level E2X (Easy to Assemble) assembly skill
Projected maximum altitude of 1, 100' (335M), 12" Diameter parachute for rocket recovery
Recommended for ages 10 and older with adult supervision up to age 12
Requires Model rocket engine, starters, recovery wadding, and glue (all sold separately)
Launch system included (Launchpad colors may vary)
Launch system included (Launchpad colors may vary)
